The reason I need them is because I saw that the default ones that come with element 3d such as "Starter_Pack" located in "C:UsersUserDocumentsVideoCopilotModels" contains both obj and e3d files so models have textures and not white, but I downloaded obj files you uploaded and when I use them they are white, no textures, if you know how to fix this without uploading e3d files, tell me

You have to assign material manually, diffuse, specular, normal and occlusion maps. Then you can save your model as a preset.

I will not do all the packages, once in a while, when I need a model I'll map it. Like I did for this model.

I already have uploaded the EMF files for Pro Shaders, will let somebody else cover e3d files for the model packages.

Regards
AD

shitx
If the obj file has the textures included, when you import it there will be a texture in the material column. You click on it and get a list in the edit column below the material column. Then open the file with the textures and drag and drop them into the appropriate slots, like "Diffuse; Specular", etc.
